item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: The Fed fine-tuned rate projections and announced more cuts in bond buying. Yellen expressed optimism about growth in 2015 and 2016.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: The S&P 500 rose 14.99 points to a record 1956.98 on the Fed's outlook. The Dow gained 98.13 to 16906.62.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: A House panel was subpoenaed for a probe into whether congressional staff helped tip off Wall Street traders to a health-care policy change.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: GM officials ignored a 2005 warning about ignition-switch flaws, according to emails released by a House panel.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: Auto-safety regulators are looking at Chrysler and Jeep vehicles for ignition-switch problems similar to GM's.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: American Apparel's board moved to fire founder and CEO Charney, citing an investigation into alleged misconduct.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: A federal agency withdrew trademark protection for the NFL's Redskins, saying the name insults Native Americans.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: Amazon unveiled a smartphone with features that include software that can recognize merchandise.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: Some funds that clashed over investments in Argentina are now in position to begin counting their winnings.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: The IRS is boosting penalties on U.S. taxpayers who hide assets abroad, while cutting fines if a failure to disclose accounts is unintentional.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: T-Mobile will waive data charges for music services, giving up potential revenue to bolster its subscriber base.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: The U.S. is signaling that it wants a new Iraqi government without Maliki, convinced the Shiite prime minister is unable to reconcile with the Sunnis.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: Iraqi forces battled insurgents for control of the country's main oil refinery and intensified efforts to halt the Sunni militants' offensive.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: Large health plans are proposing higher premiums next year for policies purchased under the Affordable Care Act.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: An Afghan candidate said he is boycotting the presidential vote count for the runoff because of alleged fraud.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: A U.S. drone strike in Pakistan's North Waziristan killed at least five militants.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: Ukraine offered to declare a temporary, unilateral cease-fire in the east after Kiev regains full control of its border.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: Detroit said it would create a hybrid pension system that workers pay into as it aims to reduce a funding shortfall.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: Senators voiced concern over White House plans for monitoring individuals who hold security clearances.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: A Senate panel voted to confirm two FERC nominees and separately approved the Keystone XL pipeline.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: Israel widened its crackdown on Hamas, detaining 72 suspects and striking at the group's financial network.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: An 89-year-old man was ordered held for his alleged role as a Nazi camp guard.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: Americans slept a little more and worked a little less on average last year.
